CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The function 'speak' in 'self.accessibility.liveRegion' takes a message as input and directly injects it into the HTML DOM without proper sanitization or escaping. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the web page, leading to various types of attacks such as stealing sensitive information, performing actions on behalf of the user, or spreading malware.
